text: 'Arrived on Friday at 7 pm and were seated promptly. From that point on everything was down the hill. Ordered nachos
column5: mixed grill

text: 'Owner Lenny is hotter than their wings

text: 'An amazing  cool and quite pub at a great location next to the park. Service is very good  and food is just delicious

text: 'Excellent food and BEST burger in Hoboken. Hands down. Never super crowded which is nice

author: Colin Valentini
text:
'Great local Irish pub with surprisingly amazing food. Staff are all extremely friendly and location is right in the heart of Hoboken.

Come here for a great glass of Guinness or any other beer for that matter. Cocktails to order are available and the wine on menu is fantastic too.

Price is fair and place is always clean. Nothing bad to say about this one. Highly recommended.'

author: James Romanelli
text: 'What a place. Def coming back'

author: BeeSee
text: 'I‚Äôm on of ‚Äúthose people‚Äù who orders their beef medium well. And this place validated that reasoning with how juicy their burgers are. Going to be hard to fight off the new found craving for their burger'

author: Darnell Tucker
text: "Best burger I've had in a while.  I will go back soon"

author: Eric Hammer
text: "Best burger in Hoboken.\n\nMy introduction to Moran's
column5: dating back to September 2018
column6: was the famous Moran's Burger with sweet potato wedges. I'll admit that it was a little much for me. Really good burger no doubt but between the irish bacon
column9: it was a bit of sensory overload. Didn't love the wedges
column10: but gave em a shot because I typically love sweet potato fries.\n\nI've been back 5 or 6 times since I think
column11: and I've elected for the BYO Burger. It's the best burger I've had in Hoboken and one of the better I've ever had. Bacon
column18:
medium or medium rare depending on the day. It's a BIG burger with a generous portion of outstanding fries.

If I had one complaint about the burger it would be that the bun is sometimes a little bready. But that's a nitpick.

Moran's is a MUST TRY if you want a burger in Hoboken. They have a sign outside that says Best Burger in Hoboken
column19: and I'm here to say it's a bonafide fact."

author: Jeremy Vega
text: 'Awesome place for food and drinks and possibly one of the best burgers out there hands down.'

author: Brian Pearson
text: 'Great local joint with consistently high quality food
column5: drinks
column8: is a rock star. More places in town should follow his lead and run an establishment the way he does. It really makes a difference. Not to mention - side note - my girlfriend calls him ‚ÄúLenny Soda Bread‚Äù because when this Irishman wears tight pants there‚Äôs a visible outline of his package that resembles a loaf of Bread as thick as a Soda Can. Geez is this guy packing . .\nAnyway
column9: great spot - the Maple Bacon Chicken sandwich is a favorite. Two thumbs up !'

text: 'Great local bar. Excellent food. Looking forward to full reopening'

text: "Awesome Irish Pub in Hoboken just off the main drag. The golf theme was awesome
column5: the service was spectacular and the food was excellent. I highly recommend the breakfast burrito with avocado. I will certainly be back to visit. Thanks for the great conversation and course recommendations Lenn. I'm glad Lowry won it!"

author: Melvin Gonzalez
text: 'Easily one of the best hidden Brunch spots in Hoboken. I got the Moran Burger and it was absolutely phenomenal. We also ordered a pitcher of Mimosas and that was good too. For the price this place is an amazing steal!'

author: Austin Song
text: 'Great burger
column5: good salad
column6:
and decent... jerk wings?

We‚Äôve passed by this place so many times and finally decided to try it out.

Great outdoor space with a view of church Square Park but it was too hot and we decided to stay inside.

Staff was friendly and attentive
column7: 5 stars.\n\nBurger was huge but also delicious (I don‚Äôt usually give high rating just bc of the portion size.  Meat was flavorful
column9:
and overall it was a great burger.

Salad was good with nice toppings.

This jerk wings was a bit mystery to me... I expected something less... wet?  It looked fried vs grilled (from the menu) and have to admit I wasn‚Äôt impressed.

I would def go back for burger and some beer!'

text: "Great to see this place grow and flourish as a top-notch neighborhood bar over the years. Come during happy hour or dinner hours to get a nice break from the hectic bars elsewhere in the area."

text: "I came in here for brunch on a Sunday and was pleasantly surprised to get what is not what you'd expect from an Irish pub.
